intro: Craterispermum congolanum, commonly known as the Congo starling tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy green foliage and showy yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange or red in color, containing seeds surrounded by a white, fleshy aril. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
